Fields.DialogueText: The worst of the worst from that mess. What did they call themselves again?
They didn't. De Telegraaf came up with "Rotterdam Four."
Nothing like brimstone to lead you humans by the nose. Are you sure the crew are ready?
They'll have to be. You can't do it alone.
Perhaps. Still, if things turn south, I want you to leave them to me.

Fields.MenuText: Is that an order?

Fields.DialogueText: A firm suggestion.

Fields.MenuText: Of course.

Fields.DialogueText: We'll both know when they do.

Fields.MenuText: We'll be fine.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm sure we will. But it's best to keep a level head in these kinds of situations, no?
Well, no time to waste. They say this first one's a Fire.
Aye-aye! Shouldn't be hard to find.
*ALARM*
Splendid. These Morganas should act as excellent target practice. Take aim!
@BATTLE
Erger. We've got a bead on those Helleveegen that escaped the siege of Rotterdam.
Freak storm?
Bad skies out there.
And claimed they were invincible.
Just what the Morganas need. Mystique.
Eyewitness reports from civilians with hunting rifles.
De Ruyter? Am I intruding?
Not at all. I'm just accustoming myself to the feel of the local waters.
Big change from the Indies?
It's a bit saltier this close to home, I think. I'm getting used to it.
Noted. Anything else to report?
Enemy inbound! Bereid je voor op de strijd!
@BATTLE
"My studies continue. Morgana destroyers appeared to be differentiated from one another by..."

Fields.MenuText: Writing to pass the time, De Ruyter?

Fields.DialogueText: Not exactly.
It's all well and good to strike these Heksen down, but you have to take note of what makes them bleed. Something I plan to keep a close eye on going forward.
Not much to observe when all they do is leave nothing but destruction in their wake.
Their destructive tendencies have been logged already, but it's important to look for patterns.
Agreed. Are you planning on devising specialized tactics for each Morgana, then?
Ja - natuurlijk. That would be one of the most obvious uses for my work. I hope it will become of use as we encroach upon Fire.
When will I get to take a look?
When I'm ready to show you, Kapitein.
When do you think that will be?
Not to be clichéd, Kapitein, but patience is a virtue.

Fields.MenuText: What are you working on?

Fields.DialogueText: Well... if you must know...

Fields.MenuText: Planning our next strategy, De Ruyter?

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose you could say so.
She of the Rotterdam Four.
... The very same.
As I was saying, the Helleveegen vary in appearance and body type. It's difficult to assume how or if they ingest organisms at all to facilitate their energy expenditure.
Maybe they run off some secret, unique power source? Maybe they feed off the destruction they cause like negatively charged succubi.
Oh? May I hear your thoughts?

Fields.MenuText: What about photosynthesis?

Fields.DialogueText: They lack the telltale green pigment typically found in the presence of chlorophyll, the molecule critical to the photosynthesis process.
So that's a no, then?
It was a good guess, though. I'll write it down in my notes, just in case!
Morgana spotted, Captain!
All right! Ready the guns! Combat stations!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Well, what about salt? Maybe they filter it through underbelly gills or something?

Fields.DialogueText: That's... something I hadn't thought about, but we've never come close enough to a Helleveege to test that theory.
Blowing them to hell comes first, right?
Heh. Of course. They would be reprobate. Speaking of which, please mind your language, Kapitein.

Fields.MenuText: What about the tears of children?

Fields.DialogueText: Kapitein? Wha...?
Perhaps they feast off their night terrors?
Pfft, be serious!
Got a laugh out of you, though!
We should be coming upon the first of the Rotterdam Four shortly. They were seen heading in this direction according to our intel.
*ALARM*
That must be it!
Already?! The report says we had a few miles left before--
Will you wave the report in the face of our enemy as a means of surrender?! Leave it to me!
De Ruyter, wait! We aren't-- For goodness' sake!
@BATTLE
Felled. And with minimal damage to the ship or crew.

Fields.MenuText: We had no business winning that fight...

Fields.DialogueText: And yet we did. What does that tell you, Kapitein? You can't always trust the numbers on the page. I've never been a fan of math anyway.

Fields.MenuText: Weren't you the one who told me to take things easy?

Fields.DialogueText: When you're ahead, minimize risk. We're far from ahead.

Fields.MenuText: You directly disobeyed me.

Fields.DialogueText: I would only do so to preserve your life, Kapitein.
You disobeyed my orders back there.
Is that so? I suppose I can look the other way just this once. Considering I have you to thank for my being alive and all.
Much appreciated.
Let's adjourn to my quarters. I want a full report of the battle.
All the more reason to stick to INPF doctrine. We don't intercept except in greater force.
From yesterday. We need to prepare for them not to respect our timetables.
All right, you ended up being correct about Fire. She'd outrun her escort.
Most squadrons have a weak link, a scouting ship, something of the sort. An outlier.
Do we?
You tell me, Kapitein. Do you consider anyone among your crew to be a little different? Special, perhaps?
Despite the tantalizing bait, we should return to the matter at hand.
Very well. Truth be told, this ship would likely cause just as much destruction as any other, but I noticed a chink in the hull and managed to target our attacks toward it.

Fields.MenuText: How did you notice such a thing?

Fields.DialogueText: The same way I notice you wiping your brow whenever you are amazed by my talents. Tissue?

Fields.MenuText: Splendid. All that note taking has paid off.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad it comes in handy. It's fun.

Fields.MenuText: Will the remaining three have the same weakness?

Fields.DialogueText: Remains to be seen.
Regardless, we have no time to rest. It looks like our upset has some Morganas... upset.
Aye-aye.
@BATTLE
Let's not use the I-word. There was a weakness and it gave us the fight.
Guess our invincible Morganas weren't so invincible after all.
There! Avarice!
*Our* Avarice! Either they're getting bolder, or we're underestimating them!
We'll have plenty of time to mull on that later. We need to make battle preparations.
Of course, Kapitein!
@BATTLE
Kapitein. May I speak with you privately?
Certainly.
What do you need?
I would like permission to devote more of my time to logging our encounters with the Helleveegen. What do you say?

Fields.MenuText: Of course, go ahead.

Fields.DialogueText: Dank je, Kapitein! I have a theory about the Helleveege activity in this area, and I am eager to see if my intuition is accurate.
You're free to do what you want if you think it will help us, Miss De Ruyter.
That means a lot to me, Kapitein. Let us hope my studies prove fruitful for us all.

Fields.MenuText: Why?

Fields.DialogueText: I just have a... gut feeling concerning our media darlings. I'd like to pursue it in my own way.

Fields.MenuText: Do what you wish.

Fields.DialogueText: Dank je, Kapitein. I just have a weird feeling about our enemy here. I have to see if I can find out why.
We made it out alive, but...
It was far from the walk in the park we hoped it would be...
Still working on your Morgana log, De Ruyter?
Actually, I'm brushing up on my language studies.

Fields.MenuText: Languages? What in particular?

Fields.DialogueText: Latin, if you must know. Hopefully it can be preserved by the few who choose to study it.

Fields.MenuText: Is this really the time for such frivolity?

Fields.DialogueText: Everything I do is for a reason, Kapitein.

Fields.MenuText: May I ask why?

Fields.DialogueText: I wondered if there were something we were missing in regards to the Rotterdam Four or Morganas in general that may be better explained in another language.
How do you figure?
It is no secret that certain words or expressions do not translate into other languages. Perhaps there is a secret hidden in an obscure language that is the key to solving the Helleveegen.
What say we put your theory to the test? Morganas inbound!
@BATTLE
More visitors, Kapitein!
All hands to battle stations!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Are you still studying? Don't let me interrupt.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm half reading and half people-watching. Would you like to join me?
Yeah? That's something I didn't expect from an academic like you.
I like to watch the dock workers and sailors scamper about. I imagine what their lives are like outside of the harbor. You know - what they're like at home, at play...
The dock workers?
Anyone, really.
Very well. I will join you in your people-watching. We can make up stories about the passersby together.

Fields.MenuText: Hello, my bookworm of a Belle. How's it going?

Fields.DialogueText: Want to try that again, Kapitein?
Sorry...
You are forgiven.
So what are you doing?
Oh, just people-watching while I catch up on my studies.

Fields.MenuText: Do you have hobbies other than studying war tactics?

Fields.DialogueText: Natuurlijk heb ik dat. You've simply caught me at a particularly tactical moment.
So what other moments do you have?
People-watching, for one.
No need to make anything up, Kapitein. See that fellow there? Where do you suppose he is going?
Well... he walks with a limp. Perhaps he is going to the hospital?
You would think so. Except, spot the paper hanging out of his briefcase. A bill six months overdue.
You can read it from this distance?
I propose he is on his way to an interrogation meeting, and aims to plead ignorance on account of his war injury.
That doesn't really exist?
Who's to say? I'm not psychic.
You sure? There's a lot of things we still don't know about you Belles.
Well, that isn't one of them. Oh, gezondheid.
But I didn't-- *Achoo!*
She's a witch!
Belle eyes.
Kapitein! In the distance!
That looks to be the third of the Rotterdam Four! Quickly, alert the crew!
*ALARM*
Are you ready, De Ruyter? These battles have only been getting more intense.
Thank goodness for that, or we'd never learn anything.
@BATTLE
Kapitein! Are you all right?
I won't go down until the rest of you fall first...
With respect, we're all dead anyway in that event.
Guess so. What of the enemy?
Defeated. Although...

Fields.MenuText: Don't tell me the fourth has shown up?!

Fields.DialogueText: No, no. Just...

Fields.MenuText: What is that face for?

Fields.DialogueText: Well...

Fields.MenuText: Out with it. My heart can't take it.

Fields.DialogueText: I found this in the wreckage, Kapitein.
A piece of cloth? This could have come from any--
Turn it over.
This emblem. This is from a German uniform, is it not?
Do you see where I'm going with this? Because I don't want to.
Let's not involve the crew in this. We still don't know everything.
Let's hope you're right.
I speculate that these attacks may not be as random as we once thought.
You suspect our allies. Against a common enemy? I would choose your words carefully.
Allies of convenience. Without the common enemy... well, I don't know what to expect from my neighbors these days.

Fields.MenuText: You're too logical to just resign yourself to uncertainty.

Fields.DialogueText: Even I have my days, Kapitein.

Fields.MenuText: It is the Germans, then? But they're neutral - toward you, anyway.

Fields.DialogueText: They are. That's what worries me.

Fields.MenuText: That is not an image I would like to imagine.

Fields.DialogueText: Nor would I. Yet, here we are.
This badge could have been left here weeks ago.
By whom? This Despair's movements have been relatively closely monitored. There were no indications that she took prisoners.
... You're right, as usual.
Regardless, I would be apprehensive about accepting any aid from a German officer at present.
It's funny you say that...
Kapitein...?
What's that? Morganas?
I didn't hear--
To battle!
@BATTLE
Well, Germany's neutral where the Netherlands are concerned.
And I doubt she took the trouble of sewing this herself. The enemy are not known for their seamstressing.
A German escort, is it?
Only as far as the 57th parallel. They insist on taking the patrols from there.
Still in their good graces, at least. Maybe mijnheer Hitler's nonsense hasn't infested the Kriegsmarine the way I'd feared.

Fields.MenuText: I didn't expect you to pout.

Fields.DialogueText: Expect the unexpected. Especially from friends.

Fields.MenuText: I trust you will be amicable.

Fields.DialogueText: Until I'm dead and buried.

Fields.MenuText: Any complaints?

Fields.DialogueText: None I could say under God's witness.
We will meet with the Fregattenkapitän shortly. We'd better clear him a path.
Aye-aye.
@BATTLE
You doing all right, Kapitein? The frigid rain feels like tiny bullets against my face!

Fields.MenuText: How do you know what being shot in the face feels like?

Fields.DialogueText: It's a figure of speech! Don't get cheeky with me, Kapitein! I'm too cold to put up with your games right now!
Morgana to port, Captain!
Time to warm up with a little fight for our lives! To battle stations!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Huddle in with me so we can warm up!

Fields.DialogueText: Goed. You stand... here, and I'll huddle right... here.
... Now I'm just blocking rain for you.
Heh. Is that so, Kapitein?

Fields.MenuText: You call these rain drops bullets?! Ha! They don't stand a chance against this modern marvel - my scarf!

Fields.DialogueText: But you're still getting soaked. Perhaps toxic gas would be a better comparison than bullets, since your clothing is absorbing the wet and cold, which could eventually kill you.
Sometimes you're a little too academic for your own good, you know that, De Ruyter?
Heh. Ja, I do, Kapitein.
The rain just will not stop. Seems the weather agrees with you about the Germans, eh?
Have you ever heard of pathetic fallacy, Kapitein?
None of that lip once our allies arrive, De Ruyter.
Natuurlijk, Kapitein. I'll be the epitome of a good host. You can count on it...
Need an umbrella? I brought you one, De Ruyter.
Oh, dank je, Kapitein! It's not really necessary, but I appreciate the thought.
*THUNDER*
Something wrong?
This is the perfect weather for an ambush. We should keep our eyes peeled for anything.

Fields.MenuText: I don't suspect anyone could pull anything on you, De Ruyter.

Fields.DialogueText: You think?
An enemy has been spotted!
Oh, please - the Kapitein was just being kind. Let's get ready, everyone!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Maybe the Morganas might call it a day as well because of the weather?

Fields.DialogueText: Unlikely, Kapitein, but it would be preferable, ja?
Enemy fleet spotted!
Battle stations!

Fields.MenuText: You heard the Belle, crew! Keep those eyes open for anything!

Fields.DialogueText: I think this weather makes me suspicious.
Captain! Enemy spotted!
Suspicious with good reason, apparently.
You really helped us out back there, Fregattenkapitän Schuler. Sorry for firing on you initially.
It is no problem at all. Apologies for firing back. We can barely see a thing in this storm. And you must be Harer Majesteits De Ruyter.
*Ahem*
Pleasure. Oh, your shirt.
Oh this? Yes, a Nixe must have blown a hole in my uniform. There should be an insignia showcasing my rank right here, you see.
And this happened recently, you say?
It is hard to know the exact time - we are at war, you know? Your Walküre is very inquisitive, Kapitän. I like her.

Fields.MenuText: I think she likes you too. You're all she's been talking about.

Fields.DialogueText: *Glare*

Fields.MenuText: She certainly is... something.

Fields.DialogueText: I will take that as a compliment.

Fields.MenuText: You two will be the best of friends in no time.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm sure of it...
Let me show you to your quarters, Kapitän. Allow De Ruyter to handle any lingering Morganas.
As you wish, Kapitein.
@BATTLE
I should have greeted him emblem in hand.
It's probably just a coincidence.
A coincidence, my go-- *ahem*

Fields.MenuText: Steady, De Ruyter.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, yes...

Fields.MenuText: He has done nothing to prove his dishonesty.

Fields.DialogueText: By the time he does, it may be too late.

Fields.MenuText: Would you like to take a minute?

Fields.DialogueText: *Inhale*.... *Exhale*....
We will monitor the captain in a strictly professional manner. Understood?
Understood.
Good. Handle the Morganas and then you're dismissed.
@BATTLE
De Ruyter?
Kapitein.
Like mistaken identity?
You've never had someone... be someone else, have you? Other than you thought they were.
... That's on them. Not you.
No mistake. Just... leaving you behind. Or the other way around.
In orde. That... that helps.
Enjoying the downtime by engaging in astronomy, De Ruyter? I hope you've calmed down a spell since we last spoke.
Jeetje! Look at me, stargazing. I need to keep my eyes down on patrol.
Maybe we could look at the constellations together after patrol is done?
Ja - natuurlijk. I would like that, Kapitein.
Morganas closing fast!
Battle stations, everyone!
@BATTLE
Oh...
Something wron-? Oh... your telescope. It must have fallen during the battle.
The glass is cracked. A shame, isn't it? Apparently, the stars were not aligned for our after-work activity. Heh...

Fields.MenuText: It was old, anyway. There's probably a newer one someone on board this ship.

Fields.DialogueText: Ja... I suppose so...

Fields.MenuText: I'm sorry about that, De Ruyter. We could get you a new one, if you wish.

Fields.DialogueText: Ja... I suppose so...

Fields.MenuText: Erm... you want to borrow my grandfather's binoculars for now? I know it can't replace your telescope but maybe it can help ease the pain for now.

Fields.DialogueText: Dank je, Kapitein, but that won't be necessary.
Well, we'll have to get you a new one. Don't want your Germans to slip one past you.
Belle eyes, Kapitein.
Can I be of assistance?
Actually, yes. I heard you were in the market for a new telescope. I too am a veteran stargazer, so I thought you could borrow mine until we part ways.
I appreciate the offer.
But?
Where did you lose your patch?
Again with the...
I would appreciate an answer before the Kapitein writes me up for speaking out of line.
I told you, these things happen in battle.
With one of the Rotterdam Four?
I don't know... Ah, Kapitän.

Fields.MenuText: Hope you are doing well.

Fields.DialogueText: As well as ever.

Fields.MenuText: I hope this one isn't causing you too much trouble.

Fields.DialogueText: On the contrary.

Fields.MenuText: Is that...? What a nice gift.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes, I was just dropping it off.
We should be crossing paths with the final Rotterdam ship soon. Let us discuss tactics in my office. All of us.
Right where we can see each other.
@BATTLE
I have been studying Morganas since we started this mission, and I believe I have a strategy that will prove effective.
Please, proceed.
Almost all of the Rotterdam Four we have faced so far have had exposures in their hulls. They are small, but if I'm right in my assumptions, I merely ask for time to find their weak spot.
Sounds good. If there are no objections, we will--
Just one. What makes these weak spots of yours inherently weak? The waterline? The magazine? Might it just be a coincidence the Nixen are feeding us?
A coincidence...
Yes.
In what world does--!

Fields.MenuText: De Ruyter!

Fields.DialogueText: *Sigh*

Fields.MenuText: Now, now.

Fields.DialogueText: Apologies, Kapitein.

Fields.MenuText: You know what I think?

Fields.DialogueText: Please, enlighten me.
I think we will follow De Ruyter's plan, I'm afraid, Kapitän. She's been right thus far, and I trust her judgment.
Kapitein...
As you wish, Kapitän. I didn't mean to impose.
Allow me to take care of any Morganas up top. Then we can start putting my plan into action.
@BATTLE
There it is, Kapitein! The final ship!
Follow the plan, everyone! Give De Ruyter enough time to survey the enemy!
@BATTLE
How is it going? We can't hold out forever!
Just a little longer!
*BOOM*
What the--! Who opened fire?!
Apologies, Kapitän! I can't risk the lives of my men based on a hunch! We will drive this beast back!
Ben je gek? You'll kill us all!

Fields.MenuText: No time to argue!
We'll have to make the best of it!
It can't be helped!

Fields.DialogueText: Kapitein, she's changing course! I can't get a clear shot!
Very well. Light her up!
We'll blind her with starshells and slip off before they close the perimeter. Willemsoord won't risk me, and neither will Command.
And she's not alone any longer.
De Ruyter-
If the Kriegsmarine want to handle it, let them.
Here comes the German ship now.
They look even more worse for wear than us.
What were you thinking out there?!
I did what I did for the lives of my men. I guessed incorrectly. But better a retreat than a defeat.
I'm sure that late helmsman of yours agrees.
What is your problem with me?
This! This German patch that was found in the wreckage of a Morgana ship. This is a Kriegsmarine emblem, is it not?
Hold that up higher... uh-huh... I'm afraid it is not. The weave is correct, but not the thread count. Nixen are not known for their seamstressing.
But...

Fields.MenuText: That's enough, De Ruyter.
Stand down, for now. That's an order.
We'll have no more squabbling.

Fields.DialogueText: Whatever disagreements we might have had, they can't interfere with the order of battle.
We are nearly at our port. I think we've learned plenty from each other about the Nixen... and the Walküren.
I wish you luck, Kapitän.
And I you. Fräulein De Ruyter, we must remain in contact. You and your countrymen are welcome to see what me and mine are building.
@BATTLE
Tensions are high and the Nixen are known mimics. Your suspicion is not groundless. But I have personally witnessed these uniforms being made.
You are extraordinary, Kapitän. But your jurisdiction is not.
Inderdaad. Let's make sure we see that day.
Here you are, De Ruyter.
Ah, Kapitein...
What are you doing down here?
I was wrong about the emblem. I planned for everything except pure, dumb coincidence.
I don't expect you to catch every little thing, De Ruyter.
But you do expect me to go on more than just a hunch.

Fields.MenuText: Two pairs of eyes are better than one.

Fields.DialogueText: I doubt a million eyes could see what needs to be seen.

Fields.MenuText: That's what I'm here for.
You're not alone.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, four is better than none.
Maybe. Maybe I really am just overreacting.
To what?
Never mind, Kapitein. We've got work to do.
@BATTLE
Kapitein! Look!
It's...
The Kriegsmarine ship...
What's left of it.
We can't let this turn our stomachs. They died doing what they thought was right. We must do the same.

Fields.MenuText: We must die...?

Fields.DialogueText: You know what I mean!

Fields.MenuText: Right!

Fields.DialogueText: Let us press on.

Fields.MenuText: I'll try not to look...

Fields.DialogueText: That's what I'm here for, right?
Ahead! There it is! Engaging the enemy!
@BATTLE
It's no use! I can't find the weak spot!
Keep at it! We'll keep it busy!
I don't understand! All signs point to the weak spot being on the hull!
And all signs pointed to that limping man being injured!
The limping... Wait a second, Kapitein! Aim a shot at the water! Right here!

Fields.MenuText: Aye-aye!
What for?!
Here?

Fields.DialogueText: Yes!
Just do it!
Here goes nothing!
*BOOM*
It's wobbling!
I was right! It has a weak spot, but it's on the underside of the hull! Keep firing! I'll assist you!
@BATTLE
Keep at it! It's nearly down!
@BATTLE
Is it over?
I think so...

Fields.MenuText: You were right, De Ruyter.

Fields.DialogueText: It is a bittersweet feeling.

Fields.MenuText: Well done, De Ruyter.

Fields.DialogueText: I hardly feel like being praised at such a moment.

Fields.MenuText: Any survivors from the Kriegsmarine ship?

Fields.DialogueText: I don't think so...
Still. We can return having completed our mission.
Aye-aye...
And avenged Rotterdam.
For now.
You're still thinking about Schuler, aren't you?
And a few things besides, Kapitein. I'm always taking notes.
Cheer up, De Ruyter. There was nothing that could be done. And think of the lives you saved by not giving up.
It is a hollow victory, niettemin.
Our job isn't done yet. There's a few stragglers between us and port.
@BATTLE
I wanted to say that I am proud of you for sticking to your guns, even in light of my fence-sitting.
Even though I was wrong.

Fields.MenuText: We are all wrong from time to time.

Fields.DialogueText: I suppose.

Fields.MenuText: A mistake is a lesson in disguise.

Fields.DialogueText: That's the scientific method, of course.

Fields.MenuText: Even though you were wrong.

Fields.DialogueText: It stings twice as hard when you say it.
You are defiant, reckless, untameable, and sometimes outright rude.
I must admit, this speech is not filling me with the MOST confidence...
But your intuition and keen eye is what won us the day. And for that...
Kapitein?

Fields.MenuText: I will never doubt your eyes again.

Fields.DialogueText: I will continue to do my best for you and the crew!

Fields.MenuText: You've caught my eye.

Fields.DialogueText: Heh. Keep looking.
*THUNDER*
*THUNDER*
Bad skies.
Eh. Let them complain.
Bad skies for it.
They'll come around.
